data.title: On March 7 1999, we lost Stanley Kubrick, who died right after completing his final film, Eyes Wide Shut. Death was a constant guest in...
data.meta_description:
104 likes, 10 comments - mikefreeman77 on March 7, 2024: "On March 7 1999, we lost Stanley Kubrick, who died right after completing his final film, Eyes Wide Shut.
Death was a constant guest in Kubrick’s films. Sometimes death was unspeakably cruel, as in Paths Of Glory, where the politics of a brutal war lead to three unjust executions.
But death could also be far more enigmatic - and not necessarily the final stop. In 2002 A Space Odyssey, space traveler Dave finds himself aging rapidly, as death seems near. But it’s not; he is reborn as a star child in an orb, floating above Earth.
And in The Shining? A homicidal Jack Torrance collapses in the Overlook Hotel’s maze and freezes to death. But does he? The final glimpse into the photo in the Overlook lobby, with Jack posing with fellow guests on July 4 1921, suggests death has met Jack more than once.
Perhaps Kubrick felt death was one stop along life’s journey - but not necessarily the ultimate one.
A brilliant man.
#stanleykubrick #stanleykubrickfilm #stanleykubrickmovies #pathsofglory #kirkdouglas #2001aspaceodyssey #starchild #theshining #theshiningmovie #jacktorrance #theoverlookhotel #deathinmovies #death #movies".
